primary.notes: Unalaska city coordinates - Iliuliuk River flows through town to Unalaska Bay

locations.comments: Iliuliuk Weir operated by Qwalangin Tribe of Unalaska in cooperation with Division of Commercial Fisheries. Located in town of Unalaska, flows from Unalaska Lake to Unalaska Bay. New monitoring station started in 2024. Important subsistence resource for Unalaska residents.
enhancement_suggestions: Verify exact weir location coordinates
Research historical data availability
Add USGS station if available nearby

legacy_coordinates.migration_reason: New location added from ADFG discovery

primary.notes: Located on Kodiak Island, approximately 0.8 km (0.5 mi) above the outlet of Big Bay Creek

locations.comments: Big Bay Creek weir operated by ADF&G Commercial Fisheries Management. Located approximately 0.8 km (0.5 mi) above the outlet of Big Bay Creek on Kodiak Island. Weir was not operated in 1997, 1999 and 2003 to 2006. Provides escapement data for commercial fishery management.
enhancement_suggestions: Verify exact weir location coordinates
Research historical data availability
Add USGS station if available nearby

legacy_coordinates.migration_reason: New location added from ADFG Commercial Fishing page

primary.notes: Located approximately 0.8 km (0.5 mi) above the outlet of the Afognak River, which flows into Afognak Bay, on the south end of Afognak Island

locations.comments: Litnik weir operated by two ADF&G Commercial Fisheries Division employees from late May to mid-September. Originally constructed in 1921 at a site approximately 0.64 km (0.4 mi) below the outlet of Afognak Lake, moved to current location in 1986. Provides escapement data for commercial fishery management.
enhancement_suggestions: Verify exact weir location coordinates
Research historical data availability
Add USGS station if available nearby

legacy_coordinates.migration_reason: New location added from ADFG Commercial Fishing page

primary.notes: Located approximately 1.6 km (1 mi) above the outlet of the Buskin River, which flows into Chiniak Bay on the northeast side of Kodiak Island

locations.comments: Buskin River weir operated by two ADF&G Sport Fish Division employees from May 21 to October 7. Upper weir at Buskin Lake outlet (6.4 km upstream) operated from mid-May through late July for sockeye salmon and steelhead. Lower weir operated from late July to September for Chinook, coho, pink, and chum salmon.
enhancement_suggestions: Verify exact weir location coordinates
Research historical data availability
Add USGS station if available nearby

legacy_coordinates.migration_reason: New location added from ADFG Commercial Fishing page

primary.notes: Located approximately 0.8 km (0.5 mi) above the confluence of the Buskin River and the tributary creek draining Lake Louise

locations.comments: Lake Louise weir operated from approximately June 1 through September 15 by two ADF&G Sport Fish Division employees who also operate the Buskin River weir. Located upstream of the lower Buskin weir site but below the Lake weir site. Escapement for Buskin River drainage includes Buskin River weir counts plus Lake Louise sockeye salmon counts.
enhancement_suggestions: Verify exact weir location coordinates
Research historical data availability
Add USGS station if available nearby

legacy_coordinates.migration_reason: New location added from ADFG Commercial Fishing page

primary.notes: Located about 0.4 km (one-quarter of a mile) below the outlet of Saltery Lake, on the northeast side of Kodiak Island

locations.comments: Saltery River weir operated by two KRAA employees and supervised by an ADF&G project biologist from early June to early August. First constructed in 1985, moved to current location in 1988 due to instability and shifting river bed. Provides escapement data for commercial fishery management.
enhancement_suggestions: Verify exact weir location coordinates
Research historical data availability
Add USGS station if available nearby

legacy_coordinates.migration_reason: New location added from ADFG Commercial Fishing page

primary.notes: Located about 1.3 km (0.8 mi) upstream of the confluence of the Karluk River and Karluk Lagoon, on the southwest side of Kodiak Island

locations.comments: Karluk River weir operated by two to four ADF&G Commercial Fisheries Division employees from mid-May to late September. First constructed in 1921 at current location, operated annually until 1941. Moved to 'the portage' from 1942-1945, then at Karluk Lake outlet from 1946-1975. Re-established at current location in 1976. One ADF&G Sport Fish Division employee assisted during Chinook salmon run from mid-May until approximately July 15.
enhancement_suggestions: Verify exact weir location coordinates
Research historical data availability
Add USGS station if available nearby

legacy_coordinates.migration_reason: New location added from ADFG Commercial Fishing page

primary.notes: Located near the outlet of Frazer Lake on the Dog Salmon Creek at the south end of Kodiak Island

locations.comments: Frazer fish pass consists of a diversion weir and series of 'fish ladders'. Constructed in 1962 to accommodate sockeye salmon stocks introduced in 1951. Operated by two KRAA funded employees and supervised by an ADF&G project biologist from mid-May to mid-August. Frazer Lake sockeye salmon first counted through Dog Salmon Creek weirs, then again as they exit fish pass to ensure sustainable population reaches Frazer Lake.
enhancement_suggestions: Verify exact weir location coordinates
Research historical data availability
Add USGS station if available nearby

legacy_coordinates.migration_reason: New location added from ADFG Commercial Fishing page

primary.notes: Located on the three lower forks of Dog Salmon Creek, 0.5 km (0.3 mi) upstream of their outlets into Olga Bay, on the south end of Kodiak Island

locations.comments: Dog Salmon Creek weir project consists of three weirs on the three lower forks of Dog Salmon Creek. First constructed in 1983, operated by two ADF&G Commercial Fisheries Division employees from early June to late August. Provides escapement data for commercial fishery management in the Alitak District.
enhancement_suggestions: Verify exact weir location coordinates
Research historical data availability
Add USGS station if available nearby

legacy_coordinates.migration_reason: New location added from ADFG Commercial Fishing page

primary.notes: Located near the outlet of Olga Creek where it drains into upper Olga Bay, on the south end of Kodiak Island

locations.comments: Upper Station weir operated by two ADF&G Commercial Fisheries Division employees from late May to mid-September. First constructed in 1929 above the lagoon, moved to current location in 1993. Has two distinct runs of sockeye salmon: early run prior to and including 15 July, and late run which occurs post 15 July.
enhancement_suggestions: Verify exact weir location coordinates
Research historical data availability
Add USGS station if available nearby

legacy_coordinates.migration_reason: New location added from ADFG Commercial Fishing page

primary.notes: Located about 1.3 km (0.8 mi) upstream from the outlet of the Ayakulik River into the Shelikof Strait, on the southwest side of Kodiak Island

locations.comments: Ayakulik River weir operated by two ADF&G Commercial Fisheries Division employees from late May to early September. Originally constructed in 1929 at the outlet of Red Lake, moved to current location in 1970. One ADF&G Sport Fish Division employee assisted during Chinook salmon run from mid-May until approximately 15 July. Provides escapement data for commercial fishery management.
enhancement_suggestions: Verify exact weir location coordinates
